channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [VFS-451] Authentication fails using private key
item.description:
Cannot connect to a ssh server with my private key.

I believe the issue is due to an JSCH bug.

Using the following lines:

session.setPassword(pass);
jsch.addIdentity(identityfile);

instead of

jsch.addIdentity(privateKeyFilePath,password);

authentication fails.
item.environment:
windows as client
linux as ssh server

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
1. Changing line 106 within SftpClientFactory (JSCH 0.1.48)
from
jsch.addIdentity(privateKeyFile.getAbsolutePath());
to
jsch.addIdentity(privateKeyFile.getAbsolutePath(),new String(password));

2. removing lines from 142 to 145.

Authentication works
Could you please provide a patch? Preferably with a unit test. Thank you b
Can you please patch against trunk which should be revision 1428413 or greater? You patch is from revision 366, which sounds completely wrong. Thank you!

Sorry, I worked on released code.
The new patch is for trunk.

Thank you for the new patch. Unfortunately, it breaks existing unit tests:

Tests in error:
  junit.framework.TestSuite@20b00ec2(org.apache.commons.vfs2.provider.sftp.test.SftpProviderTestCase$BaseProviderTestSuite): Could not connect to SFTP server at "sftp://testtest@localhost:53018/".
  junit.framework.TestSuite@fbb8694(org.apache.commons.vfs2.provider.sftp.test.SftpProviderTestCase$5): Could not connect to SFTP server at "sftp://testtest@localhost:53018/".

Please run "mnv clean test" before submitting a patch to make sure you are not creating a regression.

Thank you,

Gary

I am guessing the patch does not handle null passwords.

Hello,

In future patches, please follow the formatting in the file you patch, in particular it's "method(arg1, arg2)" and not "method(arg1,arg2)".

Thank you,
Gary

I tweaked the patch and applied it. Thank you.

Please get the latest from trunk, verify that the fix works for you, and post back here.

Thank you!
Gary

Hi Gary,
I tested the trunk and everything works.

I always used ssh-keygen and if you define an empty passphrase, it use as passphrase the OS password.
So, it sound to me strange to create Private Keys without passphrase.. but it is possible.

Finally, I didn't understand your comments at 01:34.

Marco
About code formatting? Compare your patch to what is in trunk and look at how spacing is used.
Patch has been applied and reporter confirmed successful operation.

IMHO this change is actually wrong. The password parameter is typically used for authentication if the password has to be sent as part of the URL. Now it is abused as passphrase for an identity file.

We face with this solution two problems:

  1. the password is still used in the URL (!!!)
  2. the generation of the SftpClient fails always if you have multiple identities and they do not all share the same passphrase

Therefore we should actually rollback this change and implement a solution as proposed in VFS-283 and reuse that mechanism for FTPS.

Changes reverted, resolved as duplicate, since VFS-283 supersedes this issue.

$ svn ci -m "Reverted change 1433253 of VFS-451."
Sending core/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/vfs2/provider/sftp/SftpClientFactory.java
Sending src/changes/changes.xml
Sending src/site/xdoc/testing.xml
Transmitting file data ..
Committed revision 1448916.
Apache Commons VFS 2.1 has been released. It includes this (total 171) resolved issues.
